meanings.definition: A unit of length equal to 100 meters.
meanings.sent1: The race track was exactly one hectometre long.
meanings.sent2: The hectometre marker showed the halfway point of the marathon.
meanings.sent3: The hectometre measurement was so precise that it amazed everyone.
meanings.sent4: In the land of giants, a hectometre was merely a step.
meanings.sent5: The hectometre stretched out before them like a never-ending path.

meanings.sent1: She sprinted a hectometre in record time.
meanings.sent2: The hectometre between the two buildings seemed longer in the dark.
meanings.sent3: The dog ran a hectometre to fetch the ball and back, wagging its tail.
meanings.sent4: The hectometre felt like a vast expanse to the tired hiker.
meanings.sent5: The hectometre of clear blue water sparkled under the sun.
